CREDIT CARD INFORMATION AND CHARGES

A credit card allows customers to borrow funds up to a predefined credit limit to make purchases or withdraw cash.

Common charges associated with credit cards include:
1. Annual Fee: A yearly charge for using the credit card.
2. Late Payment Fee: Charged when the minimum due amount is not paid on time.
3. Interest Charges: Interest applied on outstanding balances if full payment is not made.
4. Cash Withdrawal Fee: Extra charge for withdrawing cash using a credit card.
5. Foreign Transaction Fee: Fee applied on international transactions.
6. Over-limit Fee: Charged when spending exceeds the assigned credit limit.

Credit card users are advised to pay dues on time to avoid penalties and maintain a good credit score.
